comments.commentBody: Allow words.  Ban breakfast.

One of the better Tuesdays in a while, thanks CW. I remember that Will said commercial names used to be a no-no, but he lifted the ban. Thank goodness, or we wouldn't have ODOR-Eaters in this one. It went well with TOE.

Was anyone else reminded of the musical refrain "On a clear day, you can see Claire TREVOR"?

Coincidentally, the History International channel (a spinoff of the History Channel) has a 2-part 4-hour program titled: "Russia Land of the Tsars".

While it's true that google shows over 12 million hits for czar and only 4.5M for tsar, that hardly makes "tsar" obscure.

Indeed, in America today, "tsar" seems to be used for the Russian historical figures, while "czar" has become an accepted title for political appointees at all levels of government who have any type of decision-making powers.
Being color blind really hurt on this puzzle. The IODINE gave it away though.

What a joke-- Only a liberal could be stupid enough to think that California's problem is too little revenue.  California has many problems including overregulation, runaway unions, excessive pension spending, grandiose projects and an obscenely generous welfare system.  Real  inflation-adjusted  revenue has gone through the roof over the past few decades-- But what has gone through the floor are basic public services for the vast majority of people in this state-- those who aren't on the dole, aren't connected to our corrupt public sector unions and who just want basic services like parks that stay open and decent schools for their kids.  Sacramento has taken all of our money and given us nothing in return.  And Lakoff's solution is for us to send more money to these corrupt politicians? No thanks.

'Reframing' sounds more like 'we could not get approval for something the way we worded before, so lets re-word it and see if it will fly this time'. If an idea cannot stand on it's own merits, then maybe it is not a good idea.

Alan, for many years the "interest groups end up flooding the campaing with money" have clearly been leftist Dems-i.e., the overwhelmingly Dem state legislature. Or are you a 1-issue kinda guy (and we know what that issue might be-and on that one, If I'm correctly speculating, the side that lost spent zillions more than the winning side-btw, I may have voted as you did, but I'm not a moron who hides my head in the sand)? Why should we believe you are not one of the "morons" you decry? The rest of you must be joking. If not, you don't have a clue about the makeup of state gov't. It's overwhelmingly Dem. Finally, I believe, without looking this up, it's "Irving" Goffman, and I believe he was the original "framer" of the "framing" bit. This Lakoff guy should give credit where it's due. That he doesn't indicates he has no integrity-he's a bottom feeder looking for his Andy Warhol 15 minutes (and a pot of $$$$$, no doubt). Really, a poorly crafted article, spewing forth whatever she was told, mindlessly. It's why I lost my love for my old friend, the NYT, years ago.

Republican legislators in this state are irresponsible in opposing tax increases for very affluent persons and corporations. However, there needs to be pension reform for some local and state employees, which Democrats will probably never agree to if only a majority is needed to raise taxes.

Most people outside of California may not realize many police, firefighters and some city employees receive six figure pensions, as well as being able to retire in their early fifties.

Democrats, if they have their way, will pass major tax increases on middle and working class people in this state. People on low and generally fixed, modest, incomes may have to pay thousands more in higher sales, income, property taxes.

When we intervene into a society by force or diplomacy for whatever reason we change the dynamics many times in ways we can not foresee. Ethically we can not just write it off as collateral damage or unintended consequences. The state of the Christians in Iraq after the invasion is such an event. American Catholic communities which participate in this effort have a moral obligation not avoid it - it sits in the early prayer of confession in the Mass in case one might practice the religion. It can not be avoided by the Bishops without a damage to the Church being caused by their indifference. This continues to be the case with child rape and abuse - Irish are the latest victims.

To demand this be addressed is no different than guidance from past reformers - St. James and Martin Luther come to mind.

So, no cheers for Christians in some areas of the Province of Punjab (Pakistan) where ugly incident took place in Sargodah where extermists killed a christian and attacked worshipers with clubs and axe (report by The Christian Voice) dated 27.12.2009 - 03.01.2010 (weekly). Somewhat similar type of attacked was witnessed during a Christmas Fair in the city called Bhopal (India) - news by UCA.  So go on and give asylum to terrorists and their breeds and reject all genuine appeals of christians.

Eliminating Prop 13 would be the final nail in the coffin that would drive home owning, property tax paying Californians out of the state. All that would be left would be tax avoiding illegals and non property tax paying low income apartment dwellers. He might be a linguistics expert but he certainly does not appear to understand from where most of the State's revenue is derived. The answer is simply to cut spending (especially from a bloated and ineffective educational system); eliminate inflated sweetheart pension deals for unionized government employees and freeze salary increases and hiring in both city and State governments.
The chicken mole at the Plaza Diner is the best I have ever had

Say, NAG from Irvine, should we take away women's suffrage and make black people property? Say, maybe we should enact the Ugandan Gay Death Penalty while we're at it, and place Native Americans back in the Missions to perform slave labour? And you're bang-on about education: put those lazy 8 year old kids back in the coal mines and make 'em work for a living! Book learnin's fer sissies!

Jeez Lou-ise!

Meals From The Heart Cafe in the French Market, Farmers Market, 1100 N. Peters Street, New Orleans, LA  70116 (504)525-1953.  Home of Crab cake Passion.  Colorful, beautiful food cooked to order.  Vegetarians are raving!
Can't believe no one mentioned Campiello or Sea Salt. We ate at both places over the New Years weekend and they were fantastic. Just make sure to bring your designer bag ....
Food was surprisingly good, the shrimp Savannah especially. Great place to take multi-generational families. Charming singer (mostly reggae and pop songs) spiced up the atmosphere.

Nice smooth solve -- yes, the theme was fairly obvious, but it was fun. "The Kepi" is also a memorable short story by Colette... that's what made the word stick for me.

Thanks to all for the bonus puzzle, too!
Decent cheeseburgers, even better Onion rings and fries. My teenage boys loved it. Always crowded in season - quite small inside.

Top View

Room

Room
The Maywood Hotel is clean and well maintained. The rooms are very small, but that is normal in Istanbul. The breakfast is poor, and you have to pay extra for orange fresh or (this in new for me) an omelet. You have good access to major tourist attraction by foot (10-15 min) or by tram (2 min walk to the nearest station). Unfortunately we got a room with no windows. They would have changed it if we asked, but we only stayed for the weekend and only got in the room to change and sleep! Our friends requested a smoking room – they had a window, but still a small room.
Unfortunately the hotel is very noisy!

It will not be a panacea if it passes. We in California vote by 2/3 to raise taxes for things like schools, and the state cuts the other funding that had already been dedicated for those purposes to fund things that we will not vote for. Reducing the margins necessary may change things somewhat, but we will still expect that the majority will vote to spend on themselves, while raising taxes on the minority.

This happens at the federal level, and it affects New York as well as California. Our states pay the largest amounts of taxes, just by the sheer numbers of people, but get back among the lowest percentage of federal spending, because the rest of the country has the majority of the population, not to mention the overwhelming majority of votes in the Senate.
A sea lion, however admirable, can't really be stellar. It's a Steller (or Steller's) sea lion--Steller was a German biologist/explorer.

Try the amazingly addictive caramel cake at the Back Door Cafe in Columbia, Mississippi (near Hattiesburg).  Fran Ginn, owner and chef,  has created an enticing restaurant (food, art, wine) on Main Street in this charming small town;  layer cakes are always on the menu and whole ones can be ordered in advance for holidays and special parties.
OMG. Jersey Shore is like cigarettes.  No, much worse.

I live in Williamsburg ,Brooklyn for the past 8 years. And always follow up the new neighborhood restaurants. Barberry became a fave restaurant of mine instantly.I highly recommend this restaurant.It is a hidden treasure.
BARBERRY
